benchmark_details.name: @B ENCH (Assistive Technology Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: @B ENCH is a pioneering multi-modal benchmark tailored specifically for the domain of Assistive Technology (AT), designed to evaluate Vision-Language Models (VLMs) based on user-defined tasks important for People with Visual Impairments (PVIs). It includes five vital tasks: Panoptic Segmentation, Depth Estimation, Optical Character Recognition (OCR), Image Captioning, and Visual Question Answering (VQA).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and standardized evaluation platform for vision-language models in assisting People with Visual Impairments.

data.source: User-centered study involving Participants who are blind or have low vision for task selection based on needs.
data.size: 15,989,114 samples in total across designated tasks
data.format: Various, including datasets from Vision Language tasks.
data.annotation: Data collected and curated based on qualitative feedback from participants.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on standard evaluation of VLM tasks as defined in benchmark tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better performance, with PQ specifically measuring segmentation quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Competitive results against state-of-the-art methods as per task benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of models on curated tasks across multiple real-world datasets.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Ongoing analysis based on feedback from participants to ensure inclusivity.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent obtained from all participants.
